name: AIOS Automation & AI Infrastructure Manifest
description: Complete guide for injecting automation scripts and AI infrastructure into other repositories with detailed explanations

overview.note: All automations work without AI, but AI enhances capabilities significantly

entrypoint.description: Single entrypoint for AI agents. Points to JSON files with section references like '(security section)' for targeted reading.
entrypoint.how_it_works: agents.json contains workflow definitions that reference specific sections in other JSON files using parentheses notation, e.g., '.repo/policy/constitution.json (security section)'

section_references.purpose: Allows agents to read only relevant sections instead of entire files, saving tokens and improving speed

entrypoint.workflow: Three-pass system: Pass 0 (Context) → Pass 1 (Plan) → Pass 2 (Change) → Pass 3 (Verify)

context_determination.security: Reads constitution.json (security section) when auth/money/external systems detected
context_determination.boundaries: Reads constitution.json (boundaries section) when cross-module imports detected
context_determination.unknown: Reads procedures.json (hitl section) when something not in docs/manifest/code

reduced_repo_structure.description: .repo/ directory was severely pruned to essential files only (~60 files down from 100+)

index_json_system.description: JSON file indexes throughout the repository for quick navigation and token optimization
index_json_system.purpose: INDEX.json files provide structured metadata about directories, allowing agents to quickly find relevant files without reading entire directories

what_they_contain.file_list: All files in directory with metadata
what_they_contain.subfolders: Nested directories with links to their INDEX.json files
what_they_contain.quick_navigation: Organized navigation by application, package, or feature type

generation.auto_watch: npm run index:watch (auto-updates on file changes)
generation.frequency: Generated automatically on commit via post-commit hook

usage_for_agents.token_optimization: Read INDEX.json first to find relevant files, then read only those files
usage_for_agents.quick_navigation: Use quickNavigation section to jump to applications/packages
usage_for_agents.find_functions: Use key_classes array to find specific functions/classes
usage_for_agents.avoid_reading_all: Don't read entire directories - use INDEX.json to target specific files

index_json_system.note: .repo/INDEX.json should be generated but may not exist yet. Run 'npm run index:generate .repo' to create it.

shared_infrastructure.description: CRITICAL: Core module that all automations depend on. Provides AI integration, learning system, code analysis, git utilities, and safety checks.
shared_infrastructure.why_needed: All automation scripts import from this file. Without it, automations will fail.

AIEngine.purpose: Connects to OpenAI or Anthropic APIs for AI-powered features
AIEngine.how_to_use: Set AI_PROVIDER, OPENAI_API_KEY or ANTHROPIC_API_KEY environment variables

methods.generate: Sends prompts to AI and returns responses
methods.explainCode: Explains what code does in plain English

AIEngine.note: Automations work without AI but show warnings. AI features are optional enhancements.

LearningSystem.purpose: Tracks what automations do and how successful they are over time
LearningSystem.how_it_works: Records outcomes to JSONL files in .repo/automation/learning/ directory
LearningSystem.what_it_tracks: Success/failure rates, patterns, improvements over time

methods.getOutcomes: Gets history of what happened before

PatternLearner.purpose: Learns patterns from your codebase so automations can match your style
PatternLearner.how_it_works: Stores examples of code patterns and finds similar ones
PatternLearner.use_cases: Refactoring suggestions, code generation, pattern matching

CodeAnalyzer.purpose: Analyzes code to find problems, complexity, duplicates
CodeAnalyzer.what_it_finds: Code smells, complexity metrics, duplicate code, long functions

GitUtils.purpose: Safe read-only git operations for analyzing code history
GitUtils.what_it_does: Gets changed files, file history, bug patterns from git

methods.getFileHistory: Gets git history of a file

SafetySystem.what_it_checks: Destructive operations, production modifications, requires approval
SafetySystem.how_it_works: Blocks dangerous operations and asks for approval when needed

intelligent.description: Phase 1-2 automations focused on task management, code intelligence, and documentation. These are foundational automations that work well in any project.

automations.name: auto-detect-task-completion
automations.what_it_does: Automatically detects when tasks are completed by analyzing PRs, commits, and acceptance criteria
automations.how_to_use: npm run intelligent:task-completion [--pr-number N] [--commit SHA] [--task-id TASK-XXX]
automations.what_it_analyzes: Code changes, test coverage, documentation updates, acceptance criteria
automations.what_it_produces: Updates task status to 'Completed' when criteria are met
use_cases: Auto-update task status after PR merge

automations.name: auto-resolve-task-dependencies
automations.what_it_does: Automatically promotes tasks from backlog to TODO when their dependencies are completed
automations.what_it_analyzes: Task dependencies, completed tasks, task priorities
automations.what_it_produces: Moves tasks from BACKLOG.md to TODO.md when ready
use_cases: Prevent working on tasks with unmet dependencies
Maintain 3-5 tasks in TODO at a time

automations.name: auto-generate-task-packet
automations.what_it_does: Automatically creates task packets (structured task definitions) from code changes
automations.what_it_analyzes: Changed files, change type (feature/bugfix/refactor), affected modules
automations.what_it_produces: JSON task packet file with all task details, change type, affected modules
use_cases: Create task packets automatically from PRs

automations.name: auto-generate-pr-description
automations.what_it_does: Automatically generates PR descriptions from code changes
automations.what_it_analyzes: Changed files, change type, affected modules, breaking changes
automations.what_it_produces: Complete PR description with summary, changes, testing notes

automations.name: intelligent-adr-generator
automations.what_it_does: Automatically detects when Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) are needed and generates templates
automations.what_it_detects: Cross-module imports, API changes, schema changes, architectural decisions
automations.what_it_produces: ADR template file with context, decision section, consequences

automations.name: intelligent-breaking-change-detector
automations.what_it_does: Detects breaking changes in APIs, schemas, or public interfaces
automations.what_it_analyzes: API contracts, type definitions, public exports, schema changes
automations.what_it_produces: Report of breaking changes with migration guide

automations.name: auto-generate-test-cases
automations.what_it_does: Automatically generates test case templates from code
automations.what_it_analyzes: Functions, classes, edge cases, code structure
automations.what_it_produces: Test file templates with test cases for each function/class

automations.name: intelligent-code-cleanup
automations.what_it_does: Finds and fixes common code quality issues automatically
automations.what_it_finds: Unused imports, dead code, formatting issues, simple refactorings
automations.what_it_produces: List of issues or auto-fixes (with --fix flag)

automations.name: intelligent-code-similarity-detector
automations.what_it_does: Finds duplicate or similar code that could be refactored
automations.what_it_produces: Report of similar code blocks with similarity scores

automations.name: auto-update-documentation
automations.what_it_does: Detects when documentation is out of sync with code and suggests updates
automations.what_it_analyzes: Code changes, documentation files, API changes
automations.what_it_produces: List of documentation that needs updating
use_cases: Keep docs in sync with code

automations.name: intelligent-doc-linking
automations.what_it_does: Automatically links related documentation files together
automations.what_it_analyzes: Documentation topics, related concepts, broken links
automations.what_it_produces: Updated documentation with cross-references and fixed broken links

automations.name: auto-build-dependency-graph
automations.what_it_does: Builds a visual graph of dependencies between modules, files, or packages
automations.what_it_analyzes: Import statements, package.json dependencies, module relationships
automations.what_it_produces: Dependency graph in various formats (JSON, DOT, Mermaid)

automations.name: auto-convert-todos-to-tasks
automations.what_it_does: Finds TODO comments in code and converts them to tracked tasks
automations.what_it_analyzes: TODO comments, FIXME comments, code context
automations.what_it_produces: Tasks in BACKLOG.md with priority based on context

automations.name: auto-detect-performance-regressions
automations.what_it_does: Detects performance regressions by comparing metrics over time
automations.what_it_analyzes: Bundle size, test execution time, build time, runtime metrics
automations.what_it_produces: Report of performance regressions with before/after comparisons

automations.name: intelligent-bundle-optimizer
automations.what_it_does: Analyzes bundle size and suggests optimizations
automations.what_it_analyzes: Bundle composition, duplicate dependencies, unused code

automations.name: auto-generate-boilerplate
automations.what_it_does: Generates boilerplate code from templates based on patterns
automations.what_it_produces: Boilerplate code files matching project patterns

automations.name: intelligent-reviewer-assignment
automations.what_it_does: Suggests code reviewers based on file history and expertise
automations.what_it_analyzes: Changed files, git history, previous reviews
automations.what_it_produces: List of suggested reviewers with reasoning

ultra.description: Tier 1-9 ultra high-leverage automations. These are AI-powered, predictive, and self-healing automations that save significant time. Many learn from your codebase patterns.

tier_1_ai_powered.name: intelligent-auto-refactor
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_does: Automatically refactors code based on learned patterns, code smells, and architectural improvements
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_analyzes: Code patterns, complexity metrics, past refactorings, code smells
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_produces: Refactored code with before/after comparison, creates PR automatically
tier_1_ai_powered.dependencies: Code files, git repository, AI optional but recommended

tier_1_ai_powered.name: predictive-bug-detector
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_does: Predicts bugs before they're written by analyzing code patterns and historical bug data
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_analyzes: Code patterns, git history, bug reports, common bug patterns
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_produces: Bug predictions with suggested fixes, can prevent commits
use_cases: Prevent buggy code from being committed
tier_1_ai_powered.dependencies: Git repository, code files, AI optional but recommended

tier_1_ai_powered.name: intelligent-migration-assistant
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_does: Automatically generates migration scripts, data transformations, and rollback plans
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_analyzes: Schema changes, data patterns, dependencies, breaking changes
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_produces: Complete migration package: scripts, rollback plans, test data
tier_1_ai_powered.dependencies: Schema definitions, git repository, AI optional but recommended

tier_1_ai_powered.name: auto-api-contract-generator
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_does: Automatically generates OpenAPI specs, TypeScript types, and API documentation from code
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_analyzes: Route handlers, types, validation schemas, request/response patterns
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_produces: OpenAPI 3.0 spec, TypeScript client types, API documentation
use_cases: Keep API docs in sync with code
tier_1_ai_powered.dependencies: API route files, type definitions, AI optional but recommended

tier_1_ai_powered.name: intelligent-test-data-generator
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_does: Automatically generates realistic, contextual test data based on schemas and patterns
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_analyzes: Database schemas, existing data patterns, relationships, constraints
tier_1_ai_powered.what_it_produces: Realistic test data, data factories, fixtures with referential integrity
tier_1_ai_powered.dependencies: Schema definitions, AI optional but recommended

tier_2_predictive.name: auto-error-recovery
tier_2_predictive.what_it_does: Automatically detects and fixes common errors before they cause issues
tier_2_predictive.what_it_analyzes: Error logs, stack traces, error patterns, historical fixes
tier_2_predictive.what_it_produces: Auto-fixes for common errors, creates PRs with fixes
tier_2_predictive.dependencies: Error logs, git repository, AI optional but recommended

tier_2_predictive.name: predictive-maintenance
tier_2_predictive.what_it_does: Predicts and prevents issues before they become problems
tier_2_predictive.what_it_analyzes: Code metrics, patterns, trends, technical debt accumulation
tier_2_predictive.what_it_produces: Predictions of future issues with preventive action suggestions
tier_2_predictive.dependencies: Code metrics, git repository, AI optional but recommended

tier_2_predictive.name: intelligent-dependency-updater
tier_2_predictive.what_it_does: Intelligently updates dependencies, tests changes, and creates PRs with migration guides
tier_2_predictive.what_it_analyzes: Dependency updates, changelogs, breaking changes, test results
tier_2_predictive.what_it_produces: Updated dependencies, migration guides, PRs with changes, auto-rollback on failure
tier_2_predictive.dependencies: package.json, test suite, AI optional but recommended

tier_3_discovery.name: semantic-code-search
tier_3_discovery.what_it_does: Semantic code search that understands intent, not just keywords
tier_3_discovery.how_to_use: npm run ultra:semantic-search [--query 'how to authenticate users']
tier_3_discovery.what_it_produces: Contextual search results ranked by relevance, finds code by behavior
use_cases: Find code by what it does
tier_3_discovery.dependencies: Code files, AI recommended for best results

tier_3_discovery.name: auto-integration-test-generator
tier_3_discovery.what_it_does: Automatically generates integration tests from API contracts and data flows
tier_3_discovery.what_it_analyzes: API contracts (OpenAPI), data flows, schemas, edge cases
tier_3_discovery.what_it_produces: Complete integration test suites with scenarios and assertions
use_cases: Keep tests in sync with APIs

tier_3_discovery.name: intelligent-code-review-bot
tier_3_discovery.what_it_does: AI-powered code review that provides intelligent, contextual feedback
tier_3_discovery.what_it_analyzes: Code changes, patterns, context, best practices
tier_3_discovery.dependencies: PR information, AI required for best results

tier_3_discovery.name: auto-architecture-evolution
tier_3_discovery.what_it_does: Automatically suggests and implements architectural improvements
tier_3_discovery.what_it_produces: Architectural improvement suggestions, refactoring plans, implementation guides

tier_4_utilities.name: intelligent-test-coverage-analyzer
tier_4_utilities.what_it_does: Analyzes test coverage and automatically generates missing tests
tier_4_utilities.what_it_analyzes: Coverage reports, untested code paths, test scenarios
tier_4_utilities.what_it_produces: Coverage analysis, test templates for missing coverage

tier_4_utilities.name: auto-performance-profiling
tier_4_utilities.what_it_does: Automatically profiles code, identifies bottlenecks, and suggests optimizations

tier_4_utilities.name: intelligent-refactoring-suggestion
tier_4_utilities.what_it_does: Learns refactoring patterns and suggests improvements automatically
tier_4_utilities.what_it_analyzes: Refactoring opportunities, learned patterns, code quality

tier_5_living_codebase.name: self-healing-codebase
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_does: The codebase automatically detects, diagnoses, and fixes issues without human intervention
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_analyzes: Errors, performance, security, patterns, health metrics
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_produces: Auto-fixes with safety checks, escalates only when confidence is low

tier_5_living_codebase.name: self-optimizing-performance
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_does: Continuously monitors and optimizes performance automatically

tier_5_living_codebase.name: self-documenting-codebase
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_does: Automatically generates and maintains documentation from code
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_analyzes: Code structure, comments, patterns, API changes
tier_5_living_codebase.what_it_produces: Auto-generated documentation that stays in sync

tier_9_ai_superintelligence.name: ai-codebase-oracle
tier_9_ai_superintelligence.what_it_does: Answers questions about your codebase using AI
tier_9_ai_superintelligence.how_to_use: npm run ultra:ai-oracle [--question 'How does authentication work?']

tier_9_ai_superintelligence.name: ai-pair-programmer
tier_9_ai_superintelligence.what_it_does: AI pair programmer that helps write code

tier_9_ai_superintelligence.name: natural-language-to-code
tier_9_ai_superintelligence.what_it_does: Converts natural language descriptions into code
tier_9_ai_superintelligence.how_to_use: npm run ultra:nl-to-code [--description 'create a function that validates email']

quick_start.step_1: Copy scripts/intelligent/, scripts/ultra/, scripts/vibranium/ directories to your repo
quick_start.step_3: Add npm scripts to package.json (see package_json_scripts section)
quick_start.step_5: Optional: Set AI_PROVIDER and API keys for AI features

package_json_scripts.note: Add these to your package.json 'scripts' section. Check for name conflicts first.

requirements.ai_optional: All automations work without AI, but AI significantly enhances capabilities

environment_variables.AI_MODEL: gpt-4, gpt-3.5-turbo, claude-3, etc. (optional, default: gpt-4)

safety.git_operations: All git operations are read-only (never modifies history)
safety.destructive_operations: Blocked by SafetySystem unless explicitly approved
safety.cost_warning: AI API calls may incur costs - monitor usage

script_name_conflicts.problem: Package.json scripts may conflict with existing scripts
script_name_conflicts.solution: Check for existing script names before adding, rename if needed

missing_shared_infrastructure.problem: Scripts fail with 'Cannot find module' error

ai_not_configured.problem: Warnings about AI not being configured
ai_not_configured.solution: Set environment variables or ignore warnings (automations work without AI)

path_issues.solution: Ensure scripts are in scripts/{directory}/ structure, or update REPO_ROOT calculation

test_installation: npm run intelligent:task-completion (should run without errors)
npm run ultra:orchestrate -- --tier=1 (should run without errors)
Check that .repo/automation/learning/ directory exists or gets created
